strengths: Loved the décor inside - very clean, simple, modern, and black and white.
I like the idea of the menu - small, streamline, and focused on a few things.
What is better than a pretty sandwich? I love carbs so anything in sandwich form is great.
weaknesses: The eggs did not have any taste to it… like it needed just basic salt and pepper.
Brioche… its fluffy but its 'too fluffy' that there isn’t a good density that holds everything in the sandwich.
Not spicy at all and the flavor was just okay.
The ratio was off – meager amount of smoked salmon (like one slice/piece) to sauce.
You order from a tablet so you don’t actually have much interaction with anyone.
key_insights: The customer enjoyed the concept and décor of the restaurant but found the food lacking in flavor and quality, particularly criticizing the sandwiches for being too fluffy, poorly seasoned, and skimpy on fillings, leading to an overall disappointing experience.

strengths: The décor inside is very clean, simple, modern, and black and white.
The idea of the menu is small, streamlined, and focused on a few things.
The customer appreciates the concept of a hipster Asian fusion sandwich place.
weaknesses: The brioche bread is 'too fluffy' and doesn't hold the sandwich together well.
The eggs in the sandwiches had no taste and needed basic seasoning.
The S.O.S Sandwich was overwhelmingly flavored with mayo, lacking balance.
The Chicken Sandwich was not spicy at all and had only okay flavor.
The service was lacking, with minimal interaction and engagement from staff.
key_insights: The customer found the sandwiches lacking in flavor and criticized the brioche bread for being too fluffy, leading to a messy eating experience; while they appreciated the restaurant's decor and concept, they felt the service was impersonal and the overall experience did not warrant a return visit.

strengths: It looks prettier than it tastes to eat.
On its own it's a good egg sandwich.
weaknesses: It's not a true representation of gilgeori/Korean toast like you would get in Korea.
It lacks the heavily buttered and fried bread.
It lacks American cheese that makes the Korean native dish.
What it's trying to be it's not wholly accurate to the thing in Korea.
key_insights: The review highlights that while the dish is visually appealing and has good sauces, it falls short of being an authentic representation of Korean gilgeori toast, lacking the essential elements like heavily buttered and fried bread and American cheese.

strengths: On its own, it's a good egg sandwich.
weaknesses: It looks prettier than it tastes to eat.
It's not a true representation of gilgeori/Korean toast like you would get in Korea.
It lacks the heavily buttered and fried bread and American cheese that makes the Korean native dish.
What it's trying to be is not wholly accurate to the thing in Korea.
key_insights: The customer appreciates the taste of the sauces and finds the sandwich good on its own, but feels it does not accurately represent authentic Korean toast due to missing key ingredients like heavily buttered and fried bread and American cheese.

strengths: delightful find, tucked away near the Safeway in Bellevue downtown
excellent, fresh, and thoughtfully crafted flavors of the sandwiches
great food in a convenient location
perfect spot to grab something delicious before heading to work or during a break
weaknesses: limited seating, so it might be better suited for takeout during busy times
portions are a bit small for the price
coffee is decent—nothing extraordinary
key_insights: Semicolon Cafe in Bellevue offers high-quality, flavorful Asian-style sandwiches in a cozy setting, making it a great spot for a quick breakfast or brunch, though customers should be aware of the limited seating and relatively small portion sizes for the price.

strengths: Very cute sandwich shop with a hip but modern atmosphere.

weaknesses: The sandwich started to fall apart easily.

I just don’t think you should be charging up to $30 for bread, meat, and mystery sauce.
Self check out being popular means less personal interaction with employees.
key_insights: The customer appreciates the shop's atmosphere and location but finds the sandwich quality lacking due to excessive sauce and high pricing, leading to a mixed overall experience.

There were two little mix-ups with just one customer (two drinks) and not even during a busy time.
I'm not sure I’ll be coming back again.
